analyzed: ārabdhe dayitā mukha pratisame nirmātum asmin api vyaktam janma samāna kāla militām aṃśu chaṭām varṣati
translated: When this [moon] was begun to be created as a counterpart of the face of the beloved, it rains a mass of rays that have come together at the same time as birth.

original: ātmadrohiṇi rohiṇīparivṛḍhe paryaṅkapaṅkeruhaḥ saṃkocād atiduḥsthitasya na vidhes tac chilpam unmīlitam // / //🔽Spdśā /pa /
analyzed: ātma drohiṇi rohiṇī parivṛḍhe paryaṅka paṅkeruhaḥ saṃkocāt ati duḥsthitasya na vidheḥ tat śilpam unmīlitam  /   sp śāpa
translated: O you who are the best of the Rohini clan, the art of the Creator in opening the lotus of your bed, which is in a very bad state due to contraction, is not like that.

original: anena rambhoru bhavanmukhena tuṣārabhānos tulayā jitasya /
analyzed: anena rambhā ūru bhavat mukhena tuṣārabhānoḥ tulayā jitasya
translated: By this face of yours, O slender-limbed one, the moon, which was defeated by a scale,

original: ūnasya nūnaṃ paripūraṇāya tārāḥ sphuranti pratimānakhaṇḍāḥ // / //🔽Spdśā /pa /
analyzed: ūnasya nūnam paripūraṇāya tārāḥ sphuranti pratimāna khaṇḍāḥ  sp śāpa
translated: The shining stars are indeed the pieces of the standard for filling up the deficiency.

original: gotre sākṣād ajani bhagavān eṣa yat padmayoniḥ śayyotthāyaṃ yad akhilamahaḥ prīṇayanti dvirephān /
analyzed: gotre sākṣāt ajani bhagavān eṣa yat padmayoniḥ śayyā uttha ayam yat akhilam ahar prīṇayanti dvirephān
translated: In the lotus family, the Lord was born directly, in the morning he delights the bees all day long,

original: ekāgrāṃ yad dadhati bhagavaty uṣṇabhānau ca bhaktiṃ tat prāpus te sutanu vadanaupamyam ambhoruhāṇi // / //
analyzed: ekāgrām yat dadhati bhagavati uṣṇabhānau ca bhaktim tat prāpuḥ te su tanu vadana aupamyam ambhoruhāṇi
translated: And they have single-pointed devotion to the sun, O beautiful one, the lotuses have attained a comparison to your face.

original: murārer amī Smvsū /mu / /
analyzed: murāreḥ amī smvsūmu
translated: These are the verses of Murari.

original: koṣaḥ sphītataraḥ sthitāni paritaḥ patrāṇi durgaṃ jalaṃ maitraṃ maṇḍalam ujjvalaṃ ciram adhonītās tathā kaṇṭakāḥ /
analyzed: koṣaḥ sphītataraḥ sthitāni paritas patrāṇi durgam jalam maitram maṇḍalam ujjvalam ciram adhas nītāḥ tathā kaṇṭakāḥ
translated: The sheath is very full, the leaves are all around, the water is difficult to reach, the circle is friendly and bright for a long time, and the thorns are removed below.

original: ity ākṛṣṭaśilīmukhena racanāṃ kṛtvā tad atyadbhutaṃ yatpadmena jigīṣuṇāpi na jitaṃ mugdhe tvadīyaṃ mukham // / //
analyzed: iti ākṛṣṭa śilīmukhena racanām kṛtvā tat ati adbhutam yat padmena jigīṣuṇā api na jitam mugdhe tvadīyam mukham  /
translated: Thus, O charming one, having created that wonderful form by drawing the bee with a lotus, the lotus-born Brahmā, desiring to conquer you, could not conquer your face.🔽Of someone.

original: kasyacit / Skmsa /u /ka / /🔽Svsu /ā / / Spdśā /pa /
analyzed: kasyacid  sv su ā
translated: Of Sūryā.

original: sā rāmaṇīyakanidher adhidevatā vā saundaryasārasamudāyaniketanaṃ vā /
analyzed: sā rāmaṇīyaka nidheḥ adhidevatā vā saundarya sāra samudāya niketanam vā
translated: The abode of the essence of beauty, or the presiding deity of the treasure of charm,

original: tasyāḥ sakhe niyatam indusudhāmṛṇāla jyotsnādi kāraṇam abhūn madanaś ca vedhāḥ // / //
analyzed: tasyāḥ sakhe niyatam indu sudhā mṛṇāla jyotsnā ādi kāraṇam abhūt madanaḥ ca vedhāḥ  /
translated: Of her, O friend, the cause was certainly Cupid and Brahmā, the moon, nectar, lotus fiber, moonlight, etc.

original: bhavabhūteḥ mā /mā / /
analyzed: bhavabhūteḥ māmā
translated: Of Bhavabhūti.

original: upaprākārāgraṃ prahiṇu nayane tarkaya manāg anākāśe ko 'yaṃ galitahariṇaḥ śītakiraṇaḥ /
analyzed: upa prākāra agram prahiṇu nayane tarkaya manāk an ākāśe kaḥ yam galita hariṇaḥ śītakiraṇaḥ
translated: Send your eyes to the top of the rampart, look a little in the skyless space, who is this deer-vanishing cool-rayed one,

original: sudhābaddhagrāsair upavanacakorair anusṛtāṃ kiran jyotsnām acchāṃ navalavalapākapraṇayinīm // / //
analyzed: sudhā baddha grāsaiḥ upavana cakoraiḥ anusṛtām kiran jyotsnām acchām nava lavala pāka praṇayinīm
translated: Scattering pure moonlight followed by the garden chakóra birds, affectionate towards the fresh sprout-like wine.

original: rājaśekharasya
analyzed: rājaśekharasya
translated: Of Rājaśekhara.

original: candro jaḍaḥ kadalakāṇḍam akāṇḍaśītam indīvarāṇi ca visūtritavibhramāṇi /
analyzed: candraḥ jaḍaḥ kadala kāṇḍam akāṇḍa śītam indīvarāṇi ca visūtrita vibhramāṇi
translated: The moon is dull, the plantain stem is unreasonably cold, and the blue lotuses have disheveled beauty,

original: yenākriyanta sutanoḥ sa kathaṃ vidhātā kiṃ candrikāṃ kvacid aśītaruciḥ prasūte // / //
analyzed: yena akriyanta su tanoḥ sa katham vidhātā kim candrikām kvacid aśītaruciḥ prasūte
translated: By whom the slender one was tormented, how is that creator? And somewhere the moon emits moonlight, not cool light.

original: ayam api tasyaiva 🔽alīkavyāmuktapracurakabarībandhanam iṣād udañcaddorvallīdvayadhṛtaparīveśanihitaḥ /
analyzed: ayam api tasya eva  alīka vyāmukta pracura kabarī bandhanam iṣāt udañcat dos vallī dvaya dhṛta parīveśa nihitaḥ
translated: This one too is of the same🔽With the knot of her braid loosened, her creeper-like arms raised, and her bodice placed on her lap,

original: ayaṃ jṛmbhārambhasphaṭikaśucidantāṃśunicayo mukhendur gaurāṅgyā galitamṛgalakṣmā vijayate // / //🔽rambhoru kṣipa locanārdham abhito bāṇān vṛthā manmathaḥ saṃdndhattāṃ dhanur ujjhatu kṣaṇam ito bhrūvallim ullāsaya /
analyzed: ayam jṛmbhā ārambha sphaṭika śuci danta aṃśu nicayaḥ mukha induḥ gaura aṅgyāḥ galita mṛga lakṣmā vijayate  / rambhā ūru kṣipa locana ardham abhitas bāṇān vṛthā manmathaḥ saṃdndhattām dhanuḥ ujjhatu kṣaṇam itas bhrū vallim ullāsaya
translated: The moon of her face, with teeth as white as crystal and ready to yawn, triumphs over the fading beauty of the deer on the forehead of the fair-bodied one.🔽O slender-thighed one, cast sidelong glances all around; let Cupid in vain shoot his arrows; for a moment let him string his bow; raise your eyebrow-creeper.

original: kiṃ cāntar nihitānurāgamadhurām avyaktavarṇakramāṃ mugdhe vācam udīrayāstu jagato vīṇāsu bherībhramaḥ // / //
analyzed: kim ca antar nihita anurāga madhurām avyakta varṇa kramām mugdhe vācam udīraya astu jagataḥ vīṇāsu bherī bhramaḥ  /
translated: Moreover, let the sweet-voiced cuckoo, with its love hidden within, utter its indistinct notes; let the confusion of lutes and drums be in the world.

original: bherībhramarasya / Srk sa /u /ka /
analyzed: bherī bhramarasya
translated: Of the confusion of lutes and drums. Srs. Sau. Uk.

original: pāṇau padmadhiyā madhūkakusumabhrāntyā tathā gaṇḍayor nīlendīvaraśaṅkayā nayanayor bandhūkabuddhyādhare /
analyzed: pāṇau padma dhiyā madhūka kusuma bhrāntyā tathā gaṇḍayoḥ nīla indīvara śaṅkayā nayanayoḥ bandhūka buddhyā adhare
translated: In your hand, thinking it a lotus, in your cheeks, mistaking it for a madhuka flower, in your eyes, suspecting it to be a blue lotus, in your lips, considering it a bandhuka flower,

original: līyante kabarīṣu bāndhavajanavyāmohajātaspṛhā durvārā madhupāḥ kiyanti taruṇi sthānāni rakṣiṣyasi // / //
analyzed: līyante kabarīṣu bāndhava jana vyāmoha jāta spṛhāḥ durvārāḥ madhupāḥ kiyanti taruṇi sthānāni rakṣiṣyasi  /
translated: The irresistible bees, their desire born from confusion with their relatives, are absorbed in your tresses. How many places, young lady, will you protect?

original: pāṇineḥ / Skmsa /u /ka / / Smvsū /mu / /
analyzed: pāṇineḥ skmsauka smvsūmu
translated: Of Panini. Srs. Sau. Uk. Svs. Su. Mu.

original: dṛṣṭāḥ śaivalamañjarīparicitāḥ sindhoś ciraṃ vīcayo ratnāny apy avalokitāni bahuśo yuktāni muktāphalaiḥ /
analyzed: dṛṣṭāḥ śaivala mañjarī paricitāḥ sindhoḥ ciram vīcayaḥ ratnāni api avalokitāni bahuśas yuktāni muktāphalaiḥ
translated: The waves of the ocean, covered with Śaivāla moss, have been seen by me for a long time, and the jewels, too, have been often seen, set with pearls.

original: yat tu projjhitalāñchane himarucāv unnidram indīvaraṃ saṃsaktaṃ ca mitho rathāṅgamithunaṃ tat kutra dṛṣṭaṃ punaḥ // /
analyzed: yat tu projjhita lāñchane himarucau unnidram indīvaram saṃsaktam ca mithas rathāṅga mithunam tat kutra dṛṣṭam punar
translated: But where has the moon, free from blemishes, with the full-blown blue lotus, and the pair of cakravākas united together, been seen again?

original: vikramādityasya Skmsa /u /ka / /
analyzed: vikrama ādityasya skmsauka
translated: Of Vikramāditya

original: rathāṅgasya
analyzed: rathāṅgasya
translated: Of the cakravāka

original: anyonyopamitaṃ yugaṃ nirupamaṃ te 'yugmam aṅgeṣu yat so 'yaṃ sikthakam āsyakāntimadhunas tanvaṅgi candras tava /
analyzed: anyonya upamitam yugam nirupamam te yugmam aṅgeṣu yat saḥ yam sikthakam āsya kānti madhunaḥ tanu aṅgi candraḥ tava
translated: The pair, unmatched, compared to each other, on your limbs, which are unmatched, this is the moon, O slender-bodied one, the honey of the beauty of your face.

original: tvadvācāṃ svaramātrikāṃ madakalaḥ puṃskokilo ghoṣayaty abhyāsasya kim asty agocaram iti pratyāśayā mohitaḥ // / //
analyzed: tvad vācām svara mātrikām mada kalaḥ puṃskokilaḥ ghoṣayati abhyāsasya kim asti agocaram iti pratyāśayā mohitaḥ  /
translated: The cuckoo proclaims your words, consisting of mere sound, infatuated by the hope that there is nothing beyond practice.

original: lāvaṇyadraviṇavyayo na gaṇitaḥ kleśo mahān svīkṛtaḥ svacchandaṃ vasato janasya hṛdaye cintājvaro nirmitaḥ /
analyzed: lāvaṇya draviṇa vyayaḥ na gaṇitaḥ kleśaḥ mahān svīkṛtaḥ svacchandam vasataḥ janasya hṛdaye cintā jvaraḥ nirmitaḥ
translated: The expenditure of the wealth of beauty has not been counted, great hardship has been accepted, and anxiety fever has been created for the person residing freely in the heart.

original: eṣāpi svaguṇānurūparamaṇābhāvād varākī hatā ko 'rthaś cetasi vedhasā vinihitas tanvyās tanuṃ tanvatā // / //
analyzed: eṣā api sva guṇa anurūpa ramaṇa abhāvāt varākī hatā kaḥ rthaḥ cetasi vedhasā vinihitaḥ tanvyāḥ tanum tanvatā  /
translated: This poor girl, too, is ruined by the absence of a lover worthy of her own qualities. What purpose did the Creator have in mind when he created her body, so slender?🔽By Dharmakīrti.

original: dharmakīrteḥ Kuvalkuval / ayāvalī /
analyzed: dharmakīrteḥ
translated: A garland of gems.

original: aucityavicāracarcā / Skmsa /u /ka / 🔽kiṃ kaumudīḥ śaśikalāḥ sakalā vicūrṇya saṃyojya cāmṛtarasena punaḥ prayatnāt /
analyzed: aucitya vicāra carcā  kim kaumudīḥ śaśi kalāḥ sakalāḥ vicūrṇya saṃyojya ca amṛta rasena punar prayatnāt
translated: A discussion on propriety.

original: kāmasya ghoraharahūṅkṛtidagdhamūrteḥ saṃjīvanauṣadhir iyaṃ vihitā vidhātrā // / //
analyzed: kāmasya ghora hara hūṅkṛti dagdha mūrteḥ saṃjīvana oṣadhiḥ iyam vihitā vidhātrā
translated: Is this a medicine for reviving the body of Kāma, whose form was burned by the terrible Hūṃ sound of Śiva, created by Brahmā after grinding the moon's digits and the full moonlight, and mixing them with nectar, with great effort?

original: bhaṭṭodbhaṭasya
analyzed: bhaṭṭodbhaṭasya
translated: By Bhoja.

original: asyāḥ sargavidhau prajāpatir abhūc candro nu kāntipradaḥ śṛṅgāraikarasaḥ svayaṃ tu madano māsaḥ sa puṣpākaraḥ /
analyzed: asyāḥ sarga vidhau prajāpatiḥ abhūt candraḥ nu kānti pradaḥ śṛṅgāra eka rasaḥ svayam tu madanaḥ māsaḥ sa puṣpa ākaraḥ
translated: In the creation of her, Brahmā was the creator, the moon was the giver of radiance, and the month of flowers itself was Kāma, solely devoted to love.

original: vedābhyāsajaḍaḥ kathaṃ nu viṣayavyāvṛttakautūhalo nirmātuṃ prabhaven manoharam idaṃ rūpaṃ purāṇo muniḥ // / //
analyzed: veda abhyāsa jaḍaḥ katham nu viṣaya vyāvṛtta kautūhalaḥ nirmātum prabhavet manoharam idam rūpam purāṇaḥ muniḥ  /
translated: How could the ancient sage, dull from Vedic study, his curiosity turned away from worldly things, be able to create this captivating form?

original: kālidāsasya vikramorvaśīya /
analyzed: kālidāsasya vikramorvaśīya
translated: By Kālidāsa. Urvaśī's garland.

original: tadvaktraṃ yadi mudritā śaśikathā hā hema sā ced dyutis tac cakṣur yadi hāritaṃ kuvalayais tac cet smitaṃ kā sudhā /
analyzed: tad vaktram yadi mudritā śaśi kathā hā hema sā ced dyutiḥ tat cakṣuḥ yadi hāritam kuvalayaiḥ tat ced smitam kā sudhā
translated: If that face is sealed with the story of the moon, alas! if that is golden luster, if that eye is stolen by the blue lotuses, if that is a smile, what is nectar?

original: dhik kandarpadhanurbhruvau ca yadi te kiṃ vā bahu brūmahe yat satyaṃ punaruktavastuvimukhaḥ sargakramo vedhasaḥ // /
analyzed: dhik kandarpa dhanuḥ bhruvau ca yadi te kim vā bahu brūmahe yat satyam punar ukta vastu vimukhaḥ sarga kramaḥ vedhasaḥ  /
translated: Fie on your eyebrows, the bow of Cupid! What more shall we say? Truly, the Creator's sequence of creation is averse to repeating things.

original: rājaśekharasya /
analyzed: rājaśekharasya
translated: [Rajashekhara's]🔽[Vrbam.ra]🔽[Sks.ka.a]

original: Brbā /rā / / / Sksa /ka /ā / / /🔽Vsbvi /śā /bha / / /🔽Sdsā /da / under / /
analyzed: brbārā sksakaā  vs bviś ābha  sd sādaḥ undeḥ
translated: [Vsbvvi.sha.b]🔽[Sds.da. unde]

original: Skmsa /u /ka / / Spdśā /pa /
analyzed: sp sp sauka
translated: [Skms.u.ka] [Spdsha.pa]

original: tasyā mukhasyāyatalocanāyāḥ kartuṃ na śaktaḥ sadṛśaṃ priyāyāḥ /
analyzed: tasyāḥ mukhasya āyata locanāyāḥ kartum na śaktaḥ sadṛśam priyāyāḥ
translated: One cannot create a likeness of that face of the long-eyed beloved.

original: itīva śītadyutir ātmabimbaṃ nirmāya nirmāya punar bhinatti // / //
analyzed: iti iva śītadyutiḥ ātma bimbam nirmāya nirmāya punar bhinatti
translated: Thus, it seems, the cool-rayed one, creating and creating its own reflection, breaks it again and again.

original: tulitas tvanmukhenāyaṃ yad unnamati candramāḥ /🔽avanamramukhi vyaktam etenaivāsya lāghavam // / //🔽taspasyatīva candro 'yaṃ tvanmukhendujigīṣayā /
analyzed: tulitaḥ tvad mukhena ayam yat unnamati candramāḥ  avanamra mukhi vyaktam etena eva asya lāghavam  / candraḥ yam tvad mukha indu jigīṣayā
translated: This moon, being weighed against your face, rises up.🔽O you with a humble face, it is clear that it is by this very [face] that he is slighted.🔽This moon, indeed, is emaciated, resorting to the bank of the river, with the desire to conquer the moon of your face.

original: kṛśaḥ śambhujaṭājūṭa taṭinītaṭam āśritaḥ // / //
analyzed: kṛśaḥ taṭinī taṭam āśritaḥ
translated: [Of] Shambhu's matted hair.

original: kasyacit / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: kasyacid
translated: [Of someone]

original: tava tanvi stanav etau kurvāte vigrahaṃ gurum /
analyzed: tava tanvi stanau etau kurvāte vigraham gurum
translated: O slender one, these two breasts of yours are engaged in a serious quarrel,

original: anyonyamaṇḍalākrāntau naṣṭasandhī nṛpāv iva // / //🔽prāyaḥ stanataṭībhūmiḥ prakāmaphaladāyinī /🔽yasyām agre karaṃ dattvā yojyate nakhalāṅgalam // / //
analyzed: anyonya maṇḍala ākrāntau naṣṭa sandhī nṛpau iva  prāyas stana taṭī bhūmiḥ prakāma phala dāyinī  yasyām agre karam dattvā yojyate nakha lāṅgalam
translated: embracing each other's circles, their joints lost, like two kings.🔽The surface of the breast is generally the bestower of abundant fruits,🔽on which, having first placed the hand, the ploughshare of the nail is yoked.

original: amīṣāṃ maṇḍalābhogaḥ stanānām eva śobhate /
analyzed: amīṣām maṇḍala ābhogaḥ stanānām eva śobhate
translated: The circular shape of these breasts alone is beautiful,

original: yeṣām upetya sotkampā rājāno 'pi karapradāḥ // / //
analyzed: yeṣām upetya sa utkampāḥ rājānaḥ pi kara pradāḥ
translated: approaching which, even kings, with trembling, offer their hands.

original: lakṣmīṃ vakṣasi kaustubhastavakini premṇā karoty acyuto dehārdhe vahati tripiḍapagurur gaurīṃ svayaṃ śaṅkaraḥ /
analyzed: lakṣmīm vakṣasi kaustubha stavakini premṇā karoti acyutaḥ deha ardhe vahati tripiḍapa guruḥ gaurīm svayam śaṅkaraḥ
translated: Achyuta lovingly places Lakshmi on his chest, with the Kaustubha jewel, and Shiva himself bears Gauri on his body, with the three eyes.

original: śaṅke paṅkajasaṃbhavas tu bhagavān adyāpi bālyāvadhiḥ sarvāṅgapraṇayāṃ priyāṃ kalayituṃ dīrghaṃ tapas tapyate // / //
analyzed: śaṅke paṅkaja saṃbhavaḥ tu bhagavān adya api bālya avadhiḥ sarva aṅga praṇayām priyām kalayitum dīrgham tapaḥ tapyate  /
translated: I suspect that the lotus-born Brahma still practices long austerities to this day, in his childhood, to consider his beloved, who is devoted to all his limbs.

original: iti yuvativarṇanavrajyā ////
analyzed: iti yuvati varṇana vrajyā
translated: Thus ends the chapter on the description of young women.

original: tato 'nurāgavrajyā
analyzed: tatas nurāga vrajyā
translated: Then comes the chapter on love.

original: dattvā vāmakaraṃ nitambaphalake līlāvalanmadhyayā vyāvṛttastanam aṅgacumbicibukaṃ sthitvā tayā māṃ prati /
analyzed: dattvā vāma karam nitamba phalake līlā valat madhyayā vyāvṛtta stanam aṅga cumbi cibukam sthitvā tayā mām prati
translated: Having placed her left hand on her hip, with her waist playfully bent, her breasts turned away, her chin touching her body, standing thus facing me,

original: antarvisphuradindranīlamaṇimanmuktāvalīmāṃsalāḥ saprema prahitāḥ smarajvaramuco dvitrāḥ kaṭākṣacchaṭāḥ // / //🔽ākarṇāntavisarpiṇaḥ kuvalayacchāyāmuṣaś cakṣuṣaḥ kṣepā eva tavāharanti hṛdayaṃ kiṃ saṃbhrameṇāmunā /
analyzed: antar visphurat indranīla maṇimat muktā āvalī māṃsalāḥ sa prema prahitāḥ smara jvara mucaḥ dvitrāḥ kaṭākṣa chaṭāḥ      ā karṇa anta visarpiṇaḥ kuvalaya chāyā muṣaḥ cakṣuṣaḥ kṣepāḥ eva tava āharanti hṛdayam kim saṃbhrameṇa amunā
translated: The sidelong glances, two or three, sent with love, thick with strings of pearls and sapphires sparkling within, will surely cure the fever of love.🔽Your sidelong glances, spreading to the corners of your eyes, stealing the hue of blue lotuses, alone captivate my heart. What need for this flurry?

original: mugdhe kevalam etad āhitanakhotkhātāṅkam utpāṃśulaṃ bāhvor mūlam alīkamuktakabarībandhacchalād darśitam // / //
analyzed: mugdhe kevalam etat āhita nakha utkhāta aṅkam utpāṃśulam bāhvoḥ mūlam alīka mukta kabarī bandha chalāt darśitam  /
translated: O innocent one, this is merely the root of your arms, marked with nail-scratches, reddened, shown off under the pretense of loosening the knot of your false braid.

analyzed: kasyacid
translated: Of someone.

original: asyās tuṅgam iva stanadvayam idaṃ nimneva nābhiḥ sthitā dṛśyante viṣamonnatāś ca valayo bhittau samāyām api /
analyzed: asyāḥ tuṅgam iva stana dvayam idam nimnā iva nābhiḥ sthitāḥ dṛśyante viṣama unnatāḥ ca valayaḥ bhittau samāyām api
translated: But her two breasts seem high, her navel seems low, and her circular marks are seen uneven and high, even on a smooth wall.

original: aṅge ca pratibhāti mārdavam idaṃ snigdhasvabhāvaś ciraṃ premṇā manmukhacandram īkṣita eva smereva vaktīti ca // / //
analyzed: aṅge ca pratibhāti mārdavam idam snigdha svabhāvaḥ ciram premṇā mad mukha candram īkṣitaḥ eva smerā iva vakti iti ca
translated: And in her limbs this gentleness shines forth, and her nature is affectionate, and she speaks as if smiling, just looking at my moon-face out of love for a long time.

original: svacchandaṃ svagṛhāṅgaṇaṃ bhramati sā maddarśanād līyate dhanyān paśyati locanena sakalenārdhena māṃ vīkṣate /
analyzed: svacchandam sva gṛha aṅgaṇam bhramati sā mad darśanāt līyate dhanyān paśyati locanena sakalena ardhena mām vīkṣate
translated: She wanders at will in the courtyard of her own house, but melts away at the sight of me. Blessed are those whom she looks at with both eyes, and half with the other.

original: anyān mantrayate punar mayi gate maunaṃ samālambate nīto dūram ahaṃ tayā dayitayā sāmānyalokād api // / //
analyzed: anyān mantrayate punar mayi gate maunam samālambate nītaḥ dūram aham tayā dayitayā sāmānya lokāt api  /
translated: She talks to others, but when I come, she resorts to silence. I have been led far away by that beloved one, even from ordinary people.

original: sa khalu sukṛtibhājām agraṇīḥ so 'tidhanyaḥ vinihitakucakumbhā pṛṣṭhato yan mṛgākṣī /
analyzed: sa khalu sukṛti bhājām agraṇīḥ saḥ ti dhanyaḥ vinihita kuca kumbhā pṛṣṭhatas yat mṛga akṣī
translated: He is indeed the foremost of the fortunate, he is extremely blessed, on whose back the fawn-eyed one places her breasts.

original: bahalataranakhāgrakṣodavinyastamārge śirasi ṭasiti likṣāṃ hanti hūṅkāragarbham // / //🔽alasayati gātram adhikaṃ bhramayati cetas tanoti saṃtāpam /
analyzed: bahalatara nakha agra kṣoda vinyasta mārge śirasi ṭasiti likṣām hanti hūṅkāra garbham     alasayati gātram adhikam bhramayati cetaḥ tanoti saṃtāpam
translated: On the path marked with the dust of her very thick nail-tips, she kills a louse on her head with a sound of tsat mixed with a hum.🔽The sight of her makes the body languid, the mind very confused, and produces torment.

original: mohaṃ ca muhuḥ kurute viṣamaviṣaṃ vīkṣitaṃ tasyāḥ // / //
analyzed: moham ca muhur kurute viṣama viṣam vīkṣitam tasyāḥ
translated: And again and again it brings about delusion. The poison of love is seen to be uneven.

original: mattebhakumbhapariṇāhini kuṅkumārdre kāntāpayodharayuge ratikhedakhinnaḥ /
analyzed: matta ibha kumbha pariṇāhini kuṅkuma ārdre kāntā payodhara yuge rati kheda khinnaḥ
translated: Weary from the exertions of love, I rest my cheek on the moist saffron-red breasts of my beloved, which are as round as the temples of an intoxicated elephant.

original: vakṣo nidhāya bhujapañjaramadhyavartī dhanyaḥ kṣapāḥ kṣapayati kṣaṇalabdhanidraḥ // / //
analyzed: vakṣaḥ nidhāya bhuja pañjara madhya vartī dhanyaḥ kṣapāḥ kṣapayati kṣaṇa labdha nidraḥ  /
translated: Placing his chest in the cage of her arms, the fortunate one spends the nights, his sleep obtained in a moment.

original: dhik tasya mūḍhamanasaḥ kukaveḥ kavitvaṃ yaḥ strīmukhaṃ ca śaśinaṃ ca samīkaroti /
analyzed: dhik tasya mūḍha manasaḥ ku kaveḥ kavi tvam yaḥ strī mukham ca śaśinam ca samīkaroti
translated: Shame on the poetry of that deluded-minded bad poet who compares a woman's face to the moon.

original: bhrūbhaṅgavibhramavilāsanirīkṣitāni kopaprasādahasitāni kutaḥ śaśāṅke // / //🔽tāvaj jarāmaraṇabandhuviyogaśoka saṃvegabhinnamanasām apavargavāñchā /
analyzed: bhrū bhaṅga vibhrama vilāsa nirīkṣitāni kopa prasāda hasitāni kutas śaśāṅke  tāvat jarā maraṇa bandhu viyoga śoka saṃvega bhinna manasām apavarga vāñchā
translated: Where are the glances with the playfulness of arched brows, the anger, the favor, and the smiles in the moon?

original: yāvan na vakragatir añjananīlarocir eṇīdṛśāṃ daśati locanadantaśūkaḥ // / //
analyzed: yāvat na vakra gatiḥ añjana nīla rociḥ eṇī dṛśām daśati locana danta śūkaḥ
translated: As long as the crooked-moving, collyrium-blue-rayed bee does not sting the eyes of the doe-eyed women, for that long do those with minds torn by the distress of old age, death, separation from loved ones, and sorrow desire liberation.

original: sā yair dṛṣṭā na vā dṛṣṭā muṣitāḥ samam eva te /
analyzed: sā yaiḥ dṛṣṭā na vā dṛṣṭā muṣitāḥ samam eva te
translated: Those who have seen her or not have been robbed equally.

original: hṛtaṃ hṛdayam ekeṣām anyeṣāṃ cakṣuṣaḥ phalam // / //
analyzed: hṛtam hṛdayam ekeṣām anyeṣām cakṣuṣaḥ phalam
translated: The heart of some has been stolen, the eyes of others have borne fruit.

original: kasyacit / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: kasyacid
translated: Of someone.

original: sā bāleti mṛgekṣaṇeti vikasatpadmānaneti krama pronmīlatkucakuḍmaleti hṛdaya tvāṃ dhig vṛthā śrāmyasi /
analyzed: sā bālā iti mṛga īkṣaṇā iti vikasat padma ānanā iti krama pronmīlat kuca kuḍmalā iti hṛdaya tvām dhik vṛthā śrāmyasi
translated: O heart, you are in vain exhausted, calling her a girl, a fawn-eyed one, a lotus-faced one, and a budding-breasted one.

original: māyeyaṃ mṛgatṛṣṇikāsv api payaḥ pātuṃ samīhā tava tyaktavye pathi mā kṛthāḥ punar api premapramādāspadam // / //
analyzed: māyā iyam mṛgatṛṣṇikāsu api payaḥ pātum samīhā tava tyaktavye pathi mā kṛthāḥ punar api prema pramāda āspadam  /
translated: This is an illusion, like water in a mirage. Do not again make a place for affection on the path of abandonment.

original: dharmakīrteḥ
analyzed: dharma kīrteḥ
translated: Of Dharmakīrti.

original: avacanaṃ vacanaṃ priyasaṃnidhā vanavalokanam eva vilokanam /
analyzed: avacanam vacanam priya saṃnidhā vana avalokanam eva vilokanam
translated: Silence is speech, the presence of the beloved is seeing, the mere looking is seeing.

original: avayavāvaraṇaṃ ca yad añcala vyatikareṇa tadaṅgasamarpaṇam // / //
analyzed: avayava āvaraṇam ca yat vyatikareṇa tat aṅga samarpaṇam  /
translated: And the covering of the limbs is the offering of the limbs by the contact of the hem.

original: kālidāsasya /
analyzed: kālidāsasya
translated: Of Kālidāsa.

original: Skmsa /u /ka / / Smvsū /mu / /
analyzed: skmsauka
translated: SkmSu.U.K.

original: alasavalitaiḥ premārdrārdrair muhur mukulīkṛtaiḥ kṣaṇam abhimukhair lajjālolair nimeṣaparāṅmukhaiḥ /
analyzed: alasa valitaiḥ prema ārdra ārdraiḥ muhur mukulīkṛtaiḥ kṣaṇam abhimukhaiḥ lajjā lolaiḥ nimeṣa parāṅmukhaiḥ
translated: With languid, slow, love-moistened, repeatedly closed eyes, for a moment facing, then bashfully swaying, instantly turning away,

original: hṛdayanihitaṃ bhāvākūtaṃ vamadbhir ivekṣaṇaiḥ kathaya sukṛtī ko 'yaṃ mugdhe tvayādya vilokyate // / //
analyzed: hṛdaya nihitam bhāvākūtam vamadbhiḥ iva īkṣaṇaiḥ kathaya su kṛtī kaḥ yam mugdhe tvayā adya vilokyate  /
translated: as if vomiting the sentiment and intention hidden in the heart with the eyes, tell me, O innocent one, what fortunate man is being looked at by you today.

original: amaroḥ Amaru / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: amaroḥ amaru skmsauka
translated: Of Amaru. SkmSu.U.K.

original: yadi sarojam idaṃ kva niśi prabhā yadi niśāpatir ahni kuto nu saḥ /
analyzed: yadi sarojam idam kva niśi prabhā yadi niśāpatiḥ ahni kutas nu saḥ
translated: If this is a lotus, where is the night-light? If it is the night-lord, how is it in the day?

original: racayatobhayadharmi tavānanaṃ prakaṭitaṃ vidhinā bahu naipuṇam // / //
analyzed: racayatā ubhaya dharmi tava ānanam prakaṭitam vidhinā bahu naipuṇam
translated: When you, having the characteristics of both, are created by fate, the skill of the creator is clearly manifested.

original: abhimukhe mayi saṃvṛtam īkṣitaṃ hasitam anyanimittakathodayam /
analyzed: abhimukhe mayi saṃvṛtam īkṣitam hasitam anya nimitta kathā udayam
translated: When I was facing her, she cast a glance that was partially concealed, and laughed with words that had some other reason for their occurrence.

original: vinayavāritavṛttir atas tayā na vivṛto madano na ca saṃvṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: vinaya vārita vṛttiḥ atas tayā na vivṛtaḥ madanaḥ na ca saṃvṛtaḥ
translated: Her behavior was restrained by modesty, so she did not fully reveal her love, nor did she conceal it.

original: ko 'sau kṛtī kathaya ko madanaikabandhur udgrīvam arcayasi kasya mṛgākṣi mārgam /
analyzed: kaḥ sau kṛtī kathaya kaḥ madana eka bandhuḥ udgrīvam arcayasi kasya mṛga akṣi mārgam
translated: Who is that fortunate one, tell me, who is the only friend of Cupid? O deer-eyed one, for whom do you raise your neck and pay homage?

original: nīlābjakarburitamadhyavinidrakunda dāmābhirāmarucibhis taralaiḥ kaṭākṣaiḥ // / //
analyzed: nīla abja karburita madhya vinidra kunda dāma abhirāma rucibhiḥ taralaiḥ kaṭākṣaiḥ
translated: With your restless sidelong glances, charming like a garland of fully bloomed jasmine flowers amidst blue lotuses.

original: guruṇā stanabhāreṇa mukhacandreṇa bhāsvatā /
analyzed: guruṇā stana bhāreṇa mukha candreṇa bhāsvatā
translated: With her heavy breasts, like a guru (heavy planet), and her radiant face like the moon,

original: śanaiścarābhyāṃ pādābhyāṃ reje grahamayīva sā // / //
analyzed: śanais carābhyām pādābhyām reje graha mayī iva sā
translated: and with her slow-moving feet, she shone like a constellation of planets.

original: sāvarṇeḥ śṛṅgāraśataka /
analyzed: sāvarṇeḥ śṛṅgāraśataka
translated: The Hundred Verses on Passion by Savarni.

original: sūktimuktāvalī
analyzed: sūktimuktāvalī
translated: A String of Pearls of Poetry

original: alasavalitaiḥ premārdrārdrair nimeṣaparāṅmukhaiḥ kṣaṇam abhimukhaṃ lajjālolair muhur mukulīkṛtaiḥ /
analyzed: alasa valitaiḥ prema ārdra ārdraiḥ nimeṣa parāṅmukhaiḥ kṣaṇam abhimukham lajjā lolaiḥ muhur mukulīkṛtaiḥ
translated: With languid, slow, love-soaked, sidelong glances, turning away in a moment, bashfully swaying, repeatedly closing,

original: hṛdayanihitaṃ bhāvākūtaṃ vamadbhir ivekṣaṇaiḥ kathaya sukṛtī ko 'sau mugdhe tvayādya vilokyate // / //
analyzed: hṛdaya nihitam bhāvākūtam vamadbhiḥ iva īkṣaṇaiḥ kathaya su kṛtī sau mugdhe tvayā adya vilokyate  /
translated: as if her eyes were vomiting forth the innermost feelings and intentions, tell me, O innocent one, which fortunate man are you looking at today?

original: śrīharṣasya
analyzed: śrī harṣasya
translated: Of Sri Harsha

original: upari kabarībandhagranther atha grathitāṅgurīn nijabhujalate tiryak tanvyā vitatya vivṛttayā /
analyzed: upari kabarī bandha grantheḥ atha grathita aṅgurīn nija bhuja late tiryak tanvyā vitatya vivṛttayā
translated: Then, the slender one, turning sideways, spread out her creeper-like arms, with the fingers entwined, above the knot of her braid,

original: vivṛtavilasadvāmāpāṅgastanārdhakapolayā kuvalayadalasraksaṃdigdhaśriyaḥ prahitā dṛśaḥ // / //
analyzed: vivṛta vilasat vāma apāṅga stana ardha kapolayā kuvalaya dala sraj saṃdigdha śriyaḥ prahitāḥ dṛśaḥ  /
translated: and sent forth glances whose beauty was like a garland of blue lotus petals, with the charming corner of the left eye, the breast, half the cheek, and the playful glance revealed.

original: parameśvarasya / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: parameśvarasya
translated: Of the Supreme Lord.

original: sākūtaṃ dayitena sā parijanābhyāśe samālokitā svākūtapratipādanāya rabhasād āśvāsayantī priyam /
analyzed: sa ākūtam dayitena sā parijana abhyāśe samālokitā su ākūta pratipādanāya rabhasāt āśvāsayantī priyam
translated: She was secretly looked at by her beloved in the presence of the attendants, and in order to convey her own intention, she quickly reassured her beloved,

original: vaidarbhākṣaragarbhiṇīṃ giram udīryānyāpadeśād śiśuṃ prītyā karṣati cumbati tvarayati śliṣyaty asūyaty api // / //
analyzed: vaidarbha akṣara garbhiṇīm giram udīrya anya apadeśāt śiśum prītyā karṣati cumbati tvarayati śliṣyati asūyati api  /
translated: speaking words full of the letters of the Vaidarbha style, under the pretext of something else. Out of love, she pulls the child, kisses him, hurries him, embraces him, and even shows jealousy.

original: vyāvṛttyā śithilīkaroti vasanaṃ jāgraty api vrīḍayā svapnabhrāntipariplutena manasā gāḍhaṃ samāliṅgati /
analyzed: vyāvṛttyā śithilīkaroti vasanam jāgrati api vrīḍayā svapna bhrānti pariplutena manasā gāḍham samāliṅgati
translated: Out of shyness, even while awake, she loosens her garment by turning away, and with a mind overwhelmed by the confusion of dreams, she embraces him deeply.

original: dattvāṅgaṃ svapiti priyasya rataye vyājena nidrāṃ gatā tanvyaṅgyā viphalaṃ viceṣṭitam aho bhāvānabhijñe jane // / //
analyzed: dattvā aṅgam svapiti priyasya rataye vyājena nidrām gatā tanvī aṅgyāḥ viphalam viceṣṭitam aho bhāva anabhijñe jane  /  /
translated: Having given her body to her beloved for the sake of lovemaking, she pretends to be asleep. Alas! When the beloved one is ignorant of her feelings, her efforts are in vain.

original: kasyacit / Skmsa /u /ka / / amaroḥ
analyzed: kasyacid skmsauka amaroḥ
translated: Of someone.

original: āyāte dayite marusthalabhuvām utprekṣya durlaṅghyatāṃ gehinyā paritoṣabāṣpataralām āsajya dṛṣṭiṃ mukhe /
analyzed: āyāte dayite maru sthala bhuvām utprekṣya durlaṅghya tām gehinyā paritoṣa bāṣpa taralām āsajya dṛṣṭim mukhe
translated: When the beloved camel, the ornament of the desert land, returned, the she-camel, thinking it difficult to cross, fixed her tearful eye, trembling with joy, on his face.

original: dattvā pīluśamīkarīrakavalān svenāñcalenādarā dāmṛṣṭaṃ karabhasya kesarasaṭābhārāvalagnaṃ rajaḥ // / //
analyzed: dattvā pīlu śamī karīra kavalān svena añcalena ādarā karabhasya kesara saṭā bhāra avalagnam rajaḥ  /
translated: Having given him mouthfuls of jujube and shami leaves, she affectionately licked off the dust clinging to the mass of his mane with her own hair.

original: keśaṭasya / Sksa /ka /ā / / /
analyzed: keśaṭasya sksakaā
translated: [Keshava's]

original: Drda /rū / / /🔽Skmsa /u /ka / /
analyzed: drdarū  skmsauka
translated: [Dravid's]🔽[Sanskrit]🔽[Sanskrit]

original: Svsu /ā / / Smvsū /mu / /🔽darbhāṅkureṇa caraṇaḥ kṣata ity akāṇḍe tanvī sthitā katicid eva padāni gatvā /
analyzed: svsuā  darbha aṅkureṇa caraṇaḥ kṣataḥ iti akāṇḍe tanvī sthitā katicid eva padāni gatvā
translated: [Sanskrit]🔽The slender lady stopped after going a few steps, thinking her foot was hurt by a blade of grass,

original: āsīd vivṛttavadanā ca vimocayantī śākhāsu valkalam asaktam api drumāṇām // / //
analyzed: āsīt vivṛtta vadanā ca vimocayantī śākhāsu valkalam asaktam api drumāṇām
translated: and turned her face away, loosening even the unattached bark of the trees on the branches.

original: kālidāsasya śākuntala /🔽dūrād eva kṛto 'ñjalir na sa punaḥ pānīyapānocito rūpālokanavismitena calitaṃ mūrdhnā na śāntyā tṛṣaḥ /
analyzed: kālidāsasya śākuntala  dūrāt eva kṛtaḥ ñjaliḥ na sa punar pānīya pāna ucitaḥ rūpa ālokana vismitena calitam mūrdhnā na śāntyā tṛṣaḥ
translated: [Kalidasa's Shakuntala]🔽He joined his palms from a distance, but not for drinking water, his thirst was shaken by his head, not by tranquility, amazed by the sight of her beauty.

original: romāñco 'pi nirantaraṃ prakaṭitaḥ prītyā na śaityād apāṃ akṣuṇṇo vidhir adhvagena ghaṭito vīkṣya prapāpālikām // / //
analyzed: romāñcaḥ pi nirantaram prakaṭitaḥ prītyā na śaityāt apām a kṣuṇṇaḥ vidhiḥ adhvagena ghaṭitaḥ vīkṣya prapā pālikām
translated: The thrill too was clearly displayed continuously out of love, not out of the coolness of the water, seeing the well-maintained public water-trough by the traveler.

original: bāṇasya
analyzed: bāṇasya
translated: [Bana's]

original: calāpāṅgāṃ dṛṣṭiṃ spṛśasi bahuśo vepathumatīṃ rahasyākhyāyīva mṛśasi mṛdu karṇāntikagataḥ /
analyzed: cala apāṅgām dṛṣṭim spṛśasi bahuśas vepathumatīm rahasi ākhyāyī iva mṛśasi mṛdu karṇa antika gataḥ
translated: You often touch her trembling sidelong glance, as if to whisper a secret, and gently stroke her ear.

original: karaṃ vyādhunvatyāḥ pibasi ratisarvasvam adharaṃ vayaṃ tattvānveṣān madhukara hatās tvaṃ khalu kṛtī // / //
analyzed: karam vyādhunvatyāḥ pibasi rati sarva svam adharam vayam tattva anveṣāt madhukara hatāḥ tvam khalu kṛtī  /
translated: You drink her lip, the essence of love, as she shakes her hand. O bee, we are defeated in our search for the truth, but you are indeed successful.

original: śaku / /
analyzed: śaku
translated: (The rest is lost).

original: snigdhaṃ vīkṣitam anyato 'pi nayane yat preṣayantyā tayā yātaṃ yac ca nirambayor gurutayā mandaṃ viṣādād iva /
analyzed: snigdham vīkṣitam nayane yat preṣayantyā tayā yātam yat ca nirambayoḥ guru tayā mandam viṣādāt iva
translated: When she sends her eyes elsewhere, though they are full of affection, and when she walks slowly as if out of dejection, due to the heaviness of her hips,

original: mā gā ity uparuddhayā yad api tat sāsūyam uktā sakhī sarvaṃ tat kila matparāyaṇam aho kāmaḥ svatāṃ paśyati // / //
analyzed: mā gāḥ iti uparuddhayā yat api tat sa asūyam uktā sakhī sarvam tat kila mad parāyaṇam aho kāmaḥ svatām paśyati  /
translated: and when she speaks spitefully to her friend, saying Do not go, though she is restrained, all that, they say, is really for me. Ah, love sees its own.🔽(The rest is lost).

original: kālidāsasyaitau śākuntala /
analyzed: kālidāsasya etau śākuntala
translated: These two verses are from Kalidasa's Shakuntala.

original: vaktraśrījitalajjitendumalinaṃ kṛtvā kare kandukaṃ krīḍākautukamiśrabhāvam anayā tāmraṃ vahanty ānanam /
analyzed: vaktra śrī jita lajjita indu malinam kṛtvā kare kandukam krīḍā kautuka miśra bhāvam anayā tāmram vahanti ānanam
translated: Making the moon ashamed with the beauty of her face, holding a ball in her hand, her copper-colored face expressing a mixture of playfulness and affection,🔽I have been made a vessel for her eyes, which are like ketaka petals drawn by the tips of bees, and which have long sidelong glances as their only friends.

original: bhṛṅgāgragrahakṛṣṭaketakadalaspardhāvatīnāṃ dṛśāṃ dīrghāpāṅgataraṅgaṇaikasuhṛdām eṣo 'smi pātrīkṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: bhṛṅga agra graha kṛṣṭa ketaka dala spardhāvatīnām dṛśām dīrgha apāṅga taraṅgaṇa eka suhṛdām eṣaḥ smi pātrīkṛtaḥ  /
translated: (The rest is lost).

original: rājaśekharasya
analyzed: rājaśekharasya
translated: This is by Rajasekhara.

original: taraṅgaya dṛśo 'ṅgane patatu citram indīvaraṃ sphuṭīkuru radacchadaṃ vrajatu vidrumaḥ śvetatām /
analyzed: taraṅgaya dṛśaḥ ṅgane patatu citram indīvaram sphuṭīkuru radacchadam vrajatu vidrumaḥ śveta tām
translated: Wink with your eyes, O young woman, let the wonderful blue lotus fall; open your lips, let coral become white.

original: manāg vapur apāvṛṇu spṛśatu kāñcanaṃ kālikāṃ udañcaya nijānanaṃ bhavatu ca dvicandraṃ nabhaḥ // / //

translated: Where should the thirsty drink the nectar of moonlight? Where should the arrangement of sprays be made from the tender creepers?🔽Where is the measure of the fragrance of the bakula garlands? How can a dream directly imagine that lotus-eyed one?

translated: Even in the minds of lovers, poison is applied under the pretext of worries, by her sidelong glances, languid and sweet, the means of her play.🔽The ends of her garment fluttering, her braid disheveled by the speed of her movements, the jingling of her bracelets from the swinging of her right arm,

original: śṛṅgārasya

original: dūtīvacanavrajyā

translated: Thus, O beautiful one, though she bears hatred towards the flower-weaponed Cupid, who causes unbearable torment, the innocent one's love for you increases more and more, O fortunate one.

original: tasyaiva / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: tasya eva
translated: Of the same [poet].

analyzed: vilimpanti etasmin malayaja rasa ārdreṇa mahasā diśam cakram candre sukṛta maya tasyāḥ mṛga dṛśaḥ
translated: Smearing the directions with the moisture of sandal paste on him, the moon's orb, of the doe-eyed one, which is made of good deeds,

analyzed: acalasiṃhasya  skmsauka sksakauka smvsūmu
translated: Of Acalasinha.🔽Of the same [poet].

analyzed: prādurbabhūva subhaga tvayi dūra saṃsthe caṇḍāla candra dhavalāsu niśāsu tasyāḥ  /
translated: Appeared, O handsome one, in her nights, white with the Chandala moon, when you were far away.

original: caṇḍālacandrasya / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: caṇḍāla candrasya
translated: Of Chandalachandra.

original: vaktrendor na haranti bāṣpapayasāṃ dhārāmanojñāṃ śriyaṃ niḥśvāsā na kadarthayanti madhurāṃ bimbādharasya dyutim /

original: tasyās tvadvirahe vipakvalavalīlāvaṇyasaṃvādinī chāyā kāpi kapolayor anudinaṃ tasyāḥ paraṃ śuṣyati // / //

translated: In her separation from you, some shadow, resembling the beauty of a ripe mango, on her cheeks, dries up day by day.

original: dharmakīrteḥ / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: dharmakīrteḥ
translated: Of Dharmakirti.

original: tāpo 'mbhaḥ prasṛtiṃ pacaḥ pracayavān bāṣpaḥ praṇālocitaḥ śvāsānartitadīpavartilatikāḥ pāṇḍimni magnaṃ vapuḥ /

translated: The heat, the handful of water, the collection of tears thought out by the channel, the creeper of the wick of the lamp danced by her breath, the body immersed in pallor,

original: kiṃ cānyat kathayāmi rātrim akhilāṃ tvadvartmavātāyane hastacchatraniruddhacandramahasas tasyāḥ sthitir vartate // /

original: rājaśekharasya /
analyzed: rājaśekharasya

translated: That very face with oblique glances, those very languid words, that very throwing of the limbs, embraces my body with passion.

original: yad uktaṃ pratyuktaṃ tad apaṭu śiraḥ kampanaparaṃ priyā mānenāho punar api kṛtā me navavadhūḥ // / //
analyzed: yat uktam pratyuktam tat apaṭu śiraḥ kampana param priyā mānena aho punar api kṛtā me nava vadhūḥ
translated: What was said and replied, that is slow, ending in shaking the head. The beloved, the new bride, has again been made angry by me.

original: śambūkasya
analyzed: śambūkasya
translated: [The lover says:]

original: yadi vinihitā śūnyā dṛṣṭiḥ kim u sthirakautukā yadi viracito maune yatnaḥ kim u sphurito 'dharaḥ /
analyzed: yadi vinihitā śūnyā dṛṣṭiḥ kim u sthira kautukā yadi viracitaḥ maune yatnaḥ kim u sphuritaḥ dharaḥ
translated: If the gaze is fixed in emptiness, what is the steady curiosity? If effort is made in silence, what is the throbbing lip?

original: yadi niyamitaṃ dhyāne cakṣuḥ kathaṃ pulakodgamaḥ kṛtam abhinayair dṛṣṭo mānaḥ prasīda kim ucyatām // / //
analyzed: yadi niyamitam dhyāne cakṣuḥ katham pulaka udgamaḥ kṛtam abhinayaiḥ dṛṣṭaḥ mānaḥ prasīda kim ucyatām  /
translated: If the eye is restrained in meditation, how is there horripilation? The anger has been seen with gestures. Be gracious, what is to be said?

original: amaroḥ / Svsu /ā / / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: amaroḥ svsuā
translated: [The beloved says:]

original: ekatrāsanasaṃsthitiḥ parihatā pratudgamād dūratas tāmbūlānayanacchalena rabhasāśelṣo 'pi saṃvighnitaḥ /
analyzed: ekatra āsana saṃsthitiḥ parihatā dūratas tāmbūla ānayana chalena rabhasa śelṣaḥ pi saṃvighnitaḥ
translated: Sitting together in one place is avoided, going out is prevented from afar, even a sudden desire to bring betel is obstructed under the pretext of fetching betel.

original: ālāpo 'pi na miśritaḥ parijanaṃ vyāpārayanty āntike kāntaṃ pratyupacārataś caturayā kopaḥ kṛtārthīkṛtaḥ // / //
analyzed: ālāpaḥ pi na miśritaḥ parijanam vyāpārayanti ā antike kāntam pratyupacārataḥ caturayā kopaḥ kṛtārthīkṛtaḥ  /
translated: Conversation is not mixed, the attendants are engaged nearby, and the clever one, by the act of service to the lover, makes anger fruitful.

original: tasyaiva Amaru /
analyzed: tasya eva amaru
translated: Of him alone, O Amaru.🔽[skms.u.k]

original: Skmsa /u /ka / /🔽Svsu /ā / /
analyzed: skmsauka  su su ā
translated: [sksu.a]

original: Spdśā /pa / /
analyzed: sp śāpa
translated: [spds.p]

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Drda /rū / / / Rask /
analyzed: rask
translated: [smvsu.mu]... [drd.ru]... [rask].

original: tadvaktrābhimukhaṃ mukhaṃ vinamitaṃ dṛṣṭiḥ kṛtā cānyatas tasyālāpakutūhalākulatare śrotre niruddhe mayā /
analyzed: tad vaktra abhimukham mukham vinamitam dṛṣṭiḥ kṛtā ca anyatas tasya ālāpa kutūhala ākulatare śrotre niruddhe mayā
translated: My face is bent towards his face, my eyes are cast downwards, my ears, eager to hear his words, are blocked by me.

original: hastābhyām api vāritaḥ sapulakaḥ svedodgamo gaṇḍayoḥ sakhyaḥ kiṃ karavāṇi yānti sahasā yat kañcuke sandhayaḥ // / //
analyzed: hastābhyām api vāritaḥ sa pulakaḥ sveda udgamaḥ gaṇḍayoḥ sakhyaḥ kim karavāṇi yānti sahasā yat kañcuke sandhayaḥ  /
translated: Though restrained by my hands, the horripilation and sweat on my cheeks increase. O friends, what can I do? The bodice suddenly starts to close its hooks.

original: amaroḥ Amaru /
analyzed: amaroḥ amaru
translated: Of Amaru, O Amaru.

original: Svsu /ā / /
analyzed: su su ā
translated: [sksu.a]

original: Spdśā /pa / / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: spdśāpa
translated: [spds.p] [skms.u.k]

original: dūrād utsukam āgate vivalitaṃ saṃbhāṣiṇi sphāritaṃ saṃśliṣyaty aruṇaṃ gṛhītavasane kiṃcin natabhrūlatam /
analyzed: dūrāt utsukam āgate vivalitam saṃbhāṣiṇi sphāritam saṃśliṣyati aruṇam gṛhīta vasane kiṃcid nata bhrū latam
translated: When he comes from afar with eagerness, it is contracted; when he speaks, it expands; when he embraces, it turns slightly red; when he takes off his clothes, the eyebrow is slightly bent.

original: māninyāś caraṇānativyatikare bāṣpāmbupūrṇekṣaṇaṃ cakṣur jātam aho prapañcacaturaṃ jātāgasi preyasi // / //
analyzed: māninyāḥ caraṇānati vyatikare bāṣpa ambu pūrṇa īkṣaṇam cakṣuḥ jātam aho prapañca caturam jāta āgasi preyasi  /
translated: When the proud one's head bent down in defeat, her eyes filled with tears, alas! her beloved, skilled in worldly ways, became the object of her anger.

original: tasyaiva / Amaru /
analyzed: tasya eva amaru
translated: Of the same [poet]. Amaru.

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: skmsauka
translated: Smvsu.mu.

original: vacovṛtir mā bhūd valatu ca na vā vaktram abhito na nāma syād bāṣpāgamam aviṣadaṃ locanayugam /
analyzed: vacaḥ vṛtiḥ mā bhūt valatu ca na vā vaktram abhitas na nāma syāt bāṣpa āgamam aviṣadam locana yugam
translated: Let there be no obstruction to speech, let the face not turn away, let there be no name, let the pair of eyes be unclear with the coming of tears.

original: samāśvāsas tena praṇataśirasaḥ patyur abhavat priyā prauḍhakrodhāpy apahṛtavatī yan na caraṇau // / //
analyzed: samāśvāsaḥ tena praṇata śirasaḥ patyuḥ abhavat priyā prauḍha krodhā api apahṛtavatī yat na caraṇau  /
translated: By that, the husband's head bowed down, was comforted, though the beloved, with intense anger, did not remove his feet.

original: bopālitasya
analyzed: bopālitasya
translated: Of Bopalita.

original: kiṃ pādānte luṭhasi vimanāḥ svāmino hi svatantrāḥ kañcit kālaṃ kvacid abhiratas tatra kas te 'parādhaḥ /
analyzed: kim pāda ante luṭhasi vimanāḥ svāminaḥ hi svatantrāḥ kañcid kālam kvacid abhirataḥ tatra kaḥ te parādhaḥ
translated: Why do you roll at the feet, displeased? For masters are independent. Delighting somewhere for some time, what offense have you there?

original: āgaskāriṇy aham iha yayā jīvitaṃ tadviyoge bhartṛprāṇāḥ striya iti nanu tvaṃ mamaivānuneyaḥ // / //
analyzed: āgaskāriṇī aham iha yayā jīvitam tad viyoge bhartṛ prāṇāḥ striyaḥ iti nanu tvam mama eva anuneyaḥ  /
translated: I am the offender, by whom your life was sustained here in separation from him. Are not you to be entreated by me, that women's lives are bound up with their husbands?

original: vākkūṭasya SKM sa /u /ka / / / /
analyzed: vākkūṭasya skm sauka
translated: Of Vakkuta. Skm su.u.ka.

original: bhāvadevyāḥ /
analyzed: bhāvadevyāḥ
translated: Of Bhavadevi.

original: Skm padyā / kasyacit / Smvsū /mu / /
analyzed: padyā     kasyacid
translated: Of Padya. Of someone. Smvsu.mu.

original: yad gamyaṃ gurugauravasya suhṛdo yasmin labhante 'ntaraṃ yaddākṣiṇyarasād bhiyā ca sahasā narmopacārāṇy api /
analyzed: yat gamyam guru gauravasya suhṛdaḥ yasmin labhante ntaram yad dākṣiṇya rasāt bhiyā ca sahasā narma upacārāṇi api
translated: Where the object of affection finds room for the respect due to elders and friends, and where even jokes and attentions are given out of politeness and fear,

original: yal lajjā niruṇaddhi yatra śapathair utpādyate pratyayaḥ tat kiṃ prema sa ucyate paricayas tatrāpi kopena kim // / //
analyzed: yat lajjā niruṇaddhi yatra śapathaiḥ utpādyate pratyayaḥ tat kim prema saḥ ucyate paricayaḥ tatra api kopena kim  /
translated: where shame holds sway and oaths are used to inspire confidence - what is that called love? And what is the use of anger there?

original: bhrūbhedo racitaḥ ciraṃ nayanayor abhyastam āmīlanaṃ roddhuṃ śikṣitam ādareṇa hasitaṃ maune 'bhiyogaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: bhrū bhedaḥ racitaḥ ciram nayanayoḥ abhyastam āmīlanam roddhum śikṣitam ādareṇa hasitam maune bhiyogaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: The knitting of the eyebrows has been practiced for a long time, the closing of the eyes has been mastered, the smile has been learned with care, and effort has been made in silence.

original: dhairyaṃ kartum api sthirīkṛtam idaṃ cetaḥ kathaṃcin mayā baddho mānaparigrahe parikaraḥ siddhis tu daivasthitā // / //
analyzed: dhairyam kartum api sthirīkṛtam idam cetaḥ kathaṃcid mayā baddhaḥ māna parigrahe parikaraḥ siddhiḥ tu daiva sthitā  /
translated: The mind has somehow been steadied and made firm to maintain patience, and the preparations for the acceptance of pride have been made. But success depends on fate.

original: Amaru / Skmsa /u /ka / / Pvpadyā / /
analyzed: amaru pupadyā
translated: Amaru's Kams. U. K.

original: tathābhūd asmākaṃ prathamam avibhinnā tanur iyaṃ tato nu tvaṃ preyān aham api hatāśā priyatamā /
analyzed: tathā abhūt asmākam prathamam a vibhinnā tanuḥ iyam tatas nu tvam preyān aham api hata āśā priyatamā
translated: Thus, in the beginning, our body was undivided. Then you became the beloved, and I became the hopeless sweetheart.

original: idānīṃ nāthas tvaṃ vayam api kalatraṃ kim aparaṃ mayāptaṃ prāṇānāṃ kuliśakaṭhinānāṃ phalam idam // / //
analyzed: idānīm nāthaḥ tvam vayam api kalatram kim aparam mayā āptam prāṇānām kuliśa kaṭhinānām phalam idam  /
translated: Now you are the master, and I am the wife. What else have I attained as the fruit of my life, which is as hard as a thunderbolt?

original: amaroḥ / Amaru /
analyzed: amaroḥ amaru
translated: Amaru's Amaru.

original: Svsu /ā / / Skmsa /u /ka / 🔽yadā tvaṃ candro 'bhūr avikalakalāpeśalavapus tadāhaṃ jātā drāk śaśadharamaṇīnāṃ pratikṛtiḥ /
analyzed: svsuā  yadā tvam candraḥ bhūḥ avikala kalā peśala vapuḥ tadā aham jātā drāk śaśadhara maṇīnām pratikṛtiḥ
translated: Sva. Su. Ā. Skm. Su. U. Ka.🔽When you became the moon with a body charming with complete digits, I was immediately born as the rival of the moon's beloved.

original: idānīm arkas tvaṃ khararuci samutsāritarasaḥ kirantī kopāgnīn aham api ravigrāvaghaṭitā // / //
analyzed: idānīm arkaḥ tvam khara ruci samutsārita rasaḥ kirantī kopa agnīn aham api ravi grāva ghaṭitā  /
translated: Now you are the sun, with harsh rays, devoid of beauty, and I, casting out anger, am made of the sun's sparks.

original: acalasiṃhasya /
analyzed: acalasiṃhasya
translated: Of Acala-simha.

original: Spdśā /pa / / Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: spdśāpa
translated: Spdsha. Pa. Smvsu. Mu. Skms. U. Ka.

original: kopo yatra bhrūkuṭiracanā nigraho yatra maunaṃ yatrānyonyasmitam anunayo yatra dṛṣṭiḥ prasādaḥ /
analyzed: kopaḥ yatra bhrūkuṭi racanā nigrahaḥ yatra maunam yatra anyonya smitam anunayaḥ yatra dṛṣṭiḥ prasādaḥ
translated: Where anger is the knitting of eyebrows, where restraint is silence, where mutual smiling is appeasement, where the glance is grace,

original: tasya premṇas tad idam adhunā vaiṣamaṃ paśya jātaṃ tvaṃ pādānte luṭhasi nahi me manyumokṣaḥ khalāyāḥ // / //
analyzed: tasya premṇaḥ tat idam adhunā vaiṣamam paśya jātam tvam pāda ante luṭhasi nahi me manyu mokṣaḥ khalāyāḥ
translated: Behold now this inequality of that love, born in you, you roll at the feet, but there is no release of anger for this wicked one.

original: tasyaiva Amaru / Drda /rū / / / /
analyzed: tasya eva amaru drdarū
translated: Of the same, Amaru. Drd. Ru.

original: Svsu /ā / /
analyzed: su su ā
translated: Sva. Su. Ā.

original: Spdśā /pa / /
analyzed: sp śāpa
translated: Spdsha. Pa.

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: skmsauka
translated: Smvsu. Mu. Skms. U. Ka.

original: śaṭhānyasyāḥ kāñcīmaṇiraṇitam ākarṇya sahasā samāśliṣyann eva praśithilabhujagranthir abhavaḥ /
analyzed: śaṭha anyasyāḥ kāñcī maṇi raṇitam ākarṇya sahasā samāśliṣyan eva praśithila bhuja granthiḥ abhavaḥ
translated: Hearing the jingling of the girdle-gem of that deceitful one, you suddenly embraced, but the knot of your arms became loose.

original: tad etat kvācakṣe ghṛtamadhumaya tvanmṛduvaco viṣeṇāghūrṇantī kim api na sakhīyaṃ gaṇayati // / //
analyzed: tat etat kva ācakṣe ghṛta madhu maya tvad mṛdu vacaḥ viṣeṇa āghūrṇantī kim api na sakhī iyam gaṇayati  /
translated: Where shall I tell this? This friend of yours, reeling with poison from your soft words full of ghee and honey, does not at all understand anything.

original: hiṅgokasya //
analyzed: hiṅgokasya
translated: Of Hingoka.

original: mugdhāsi nāyam aparādhyati maivam āli keyaṃ ruṣā paruṣitā likhitāpy anena /
analyzed: mugdhā asi na ayam aparādhyati mā evam āli kā iyam ruṣā paruṣitā likhitā api anena
translated: You are innocent, this one does not offend, do not be angry, friend. Even though he has written harshly out of anger,

original: keliskhaladvasanam utpulakāṅgabhaṅgam uttuṅgapīnakucam ālikhitā tvam eva // / //
analyzed: keli skhalat vasanam utpulaka aṅga bhaṅgam uttuṅga pīna kucam ālikhitā tvam eva
translated: it is you alone he has drawn, with your playful garment slipping, your body trembling with horripilation, and your high and full breasts.

original: vīryamitrasya //🔽pāṇau śoṇatale tanūdari darakṣāmā kapolasthalī vinyastāñjanadigdhalocanajalaiḥ kiṃ mlānimānīyate /
analyzed: vīrya mitrasya  pāṇau śoṇa tale tanu udari dara kṣāmā kapola sthalī vinyasta añjana digdha locana jalaiḥ kim mlānim ānīyate
translated: Of Vīryamitra.🔽O slender-waisted one, why is the smooth cheek placed on the red palm made pale by the tears from the eyes smeared with collyrium?

original: mugdhe cumbatu nāma cañcalatayā bhṛṅgaḥ kvacit kandalīm unmīlannavamālatīparimalaḥ kiṃ tena vismaryate // / //
analyzed: mugdhe cumbatu nāma cañcala tayā bhṛṅgaḥ kvacid kandalīm unmīlat nava mālatī parimalaḥ kim tena vismaryate
translated: Let the bee, being fickle, kiss a banana plant somewhere, O innocent one. Is the fragrance of the newly blooming jasmine forgotten because of that?

original: kasyacit / Skmsa /u /ka / 🔽kopaḥ sakhi priyatame nanu vañcanaiva tan muñca mānini ruṣaṃ kriyatāṃ prasādaḥ /
analyzed: kasyacid  kopaḥ sakhi priyatame nanu vañcanā eva tat muñca mānini ruṣam kriyatām prasādaḥ
translated: Of someone.🔽Anger, O friend, is indeed a deception towards the beloved. Therefore, O proud one, let go of your anger and be gracious.

original: prāṇeśvaraś caraṇayoḥ patitas tavāyaṃ saṃbhāṣyatāṃ vikasatā nayanotpalena // / //
analyzed: prāṇeśvaraḥ caraṇayoḥ patitaḥ tava ayam saṃbhāṣyatām vikasatā nayana utpalena  /
translated: This lord of my life has fallen at your feet. Let him be addressed with an eye-blossom blooming.

original: bāle nātha vimuñca mānini ruṣaṃ roṣān mayā kiṃ kṛtaṃ khedo 'smāsu na me 'parādhyati bhavān sarve 'parādhā mayi /
analyzed: bāle nātha vimuñca mānini ruṣam roṣāt mayā kim kṛtam smāsu na me parādhyati bhavān sarve parādhāḥ mayi
translated: O my lord, O proud one, give up anger, what have I done to anger you? I am not offended with you, all the offences are on me.

original: tat kiṃ rodiṣi gadgadena vacasā kasyāgrato rudyate nanv etan mama kā tavāsmi dayitā nāsmīty ato rudyate // / //
analyzed: tat kim rodiṣi gadgadena vacasā kasya agratas rudyate nanu etat mama kā tava asmi dayitā na asmi iti atas rudyate  /
translated: Then why do you weep with a stammering voice, before whom are you weeping? Is it not that I am yours, and you are not mine? For this reason you weep.

original: amaroḥ Amaru / Drda /rū / / / Svsu /ā / /
analyzed: amaroḥ amaru drdarū
translated: [O] immortal, O immortal, O hard-hearted one, O my own, O come.

original: Spdśā /pa / /
analyzed: sp śāpa
translated: O touch, O friend,

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Srk sa /u /ka /
analyzed: srk sauka
translated: O mind, O soul, O go, O come, O go, O come.

original: gataprāyā rātriḥ kṛśatanu śaśī śīryata iva pradīpo 'ya nidrāvaśam upagato ghūrṇata iva /
analyzed: gata prāyā rātriḥ kṛśa tanu śaśī śīryate iva pradīpaḥ nidrā vaśam upagataḥ ghūrṇataḥ iva
translated: The night is almost gone, O slender-bodied one, the moon seems to be fading away, the lamp is about to go out, as if reeling.

original: praṇāmānto mānas tyajasi na tathāpi krudham aho kucapratyāsattyā hṛdayam api te caṇḍi kaṭhinam // / //
analyzed: praṇāma antaḥ mānaḥ tyajasi na tathā api krudham aho kuca pratyāsattyā hṛdayam api te caṇḍi kaṭhinam  /
translated: You do not give up anger even when I bow down, O fierce one, your heart too is hard, as if in close proximity to your breasts.

original: kasyacit
analyzed: kasyacid
translated: Of someone.

original: gato dūraṃ candro jaṭharalavalīpāṇḍaravapur diśaḥ kiṃcit kiṃcit taraṇikiraṇair lohitarucaḥ /
analyzed: gataḥ dūram candraḥ jaṭhara lavalī pāṇḍara vapuḥ diśaḥ kiṃcid kiṃcid taraṇi kiraṇaiḥ lohita rucaḥ
translated: The moon has gone far, its body pale like a wild jujube fruit, the directions are slightly red with the rays of the rising sun.

original: idaṃ nidrācchede rasati sarasaṃ sārasakulaṃ cakorākṣi kṣipraṃ jahihi jahihi premalaḍitam // / //
analyzed: idam nidrā chede rasati sa rasam sārasa kulam cakora akṣi kṣipram jahihi jahihi prema laḍitam
translated: This group of ruddy geese is singing sweetly to break the sleep. O gazelle-eyed one, quickly give up, give up the playfulness of love.

original: kasyacit
analyzed: kasyacid
translated: Of someone.

original: mayā tāvadgotraskhalitahatakopāntaritayā na ruddho nirgacchann ayam iti vilakṣaḥ priyatamaḥ /
analyzed: mayā tāvat gotra skhalita hata kopa antaritayā na ruddhaḥ nirgacchan ayam iti vilakṣaḥ priyatamaḥ
translated: I, on the other hand, being overcome with anger at the fall from virtue, did not stop my beloved as he was leaving, thinking, Let him go.

original: ayaṃ tvākūtajñaḥ pariṇatiparāmarśakuśalaḥ sakhī līko 'py āsīl likhita iva citreṇa kim idam // / //
analyzed: ayam tu ākūta jñaḥ pariṇati parāmarśa kuśalaḥ sakhī pi āsīt likhitaḥ iva citreṇa kim idam  /
translated: But this friend, who understands intentions and is skilled in discerning consequences, was also a jester. What is this, as if written with a picture?

original: bimbokasya /🔽Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: bimbokasya  skmsauka
translated: Of Bimboka.🔽Of Dharmakirti.

original: bhavatu viditaṃ chadmālāpair alaṃ priya gamyatāṃ tanur api na te doṣo 'smākaṃ vidhis tu parāṅmukhaḥ /
analyzed: bhavatu viditam chadma ālāpaiḥ alam priya gamyatām tanuḥ api na te doṣaḥ smākam vidhiḥ tu parāṅmukhaḥ
translated: Enough of these deceitful words, dear one. Go away. It is not your fault, but fate is averse to us.

original: tava yathā tathābhūtaṃ prema prapannam imāṃ daśāṃ prakṛticapale kā naḥ pīḍā gate hatajīvite // / //
analyzed: tava yathā tathābhūtam prema prapannam imām daśām prakṛti capale kā naḥ pīḍā gate hata jīvite  /
translated: Your love, which was such and such, has fallen into this state. What pain is there for us, O fickle by nature, when the one who has taken your life has gone?🔽Of Amaru.

original: dharmakīrteḥ Amaru / Svsu /ā / /🔽Smvsū /mu / / /
analyzed: dharmakīrteḥ amaru  smvsūmu
translated: Of Dharmakirti.

original: Skmsa /u /ka / bimbokasya / Pvpadyā /
analyzed: bimbokasya pvpadyā
translated: Of Bimboka. Of Padya.

original: asadvṛtto nāyaṃ na ca sakhi guṇair eṣa rahitaḥ priyo muktāhāras tava caraṇamūle nipatitaḥ /
analyzed: asat vṛttaḥ na ayam na ca sakhi guṇaiḥ eṣa rahitaḥ priyaḥ muktā hāraḥ tava caraṇa mūle nipatitaḥ
translated: This lover is not of bad conduct, nor is he devoid of virtues, O friend. The pearl necklace has fallen at your feet.

original: gṛhāṇainaṃ mugdhe vrajatu tava kaṇṭhapraṇayitām upāyo nāsty anyo hṛdayaparitāpopaśamane // / //
analyzed: gṛhāṇa enam mugdhe vrajatu tava kaṇṭha praṇayi tām upāyaḥ nā asti anyaḥ hṛdaya paritāpa upaśamane  /
translated: Take it, O innocent one, let it go to the intimacy of your neck. There is no other means for alleviating the pain of the heart.

original: bhaṭṭahareḥ /
analyzed: bhaṭṭahareḥ
translated: Of Bhatta Hari.

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka / /
analyzed: skmsauka
translated: SVSUS MU SKMS U KA

original: bimbokasya
analyzed: bimbokasya
translated: Of Bimboka

original: anālocya premṇaḥ pariṇatim anādṛtya suhṛdas tvayākāṇḍe mānaḥ kim iti sarale preyasi kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: an ālocya premṇaḥ pariṇatim an ādṛtya suhṛdaḥ tvayā akāṇḍe mānaḥ kim iti sarale preyasi kṛtaḥ
translated: Why, simple one, have you suddenly shown anger towards your beloved, without considering the change in love and disregarding your friend?

original: samākṛṣṭā hy ete virahadahanodbhāsuraśikhāḥ svahastenāñgārās tad alam adhunāraṇyaruditaiḥ // / //
analyzed: samākṛṣṭāḥ hi ete viraha dahana udbhāsura śikhāḥ sva hastena añgārāḥ tat alam adhunā araṇyaruditaiḥ  /
translated: For these embers, glowing with the flames of the fire of separation, have been drawn out by your own hand. So now enough of weeping in the forest.

original: vikaṭanitambāyāḥ Amaru /🔽Sbhsu /ā /v /
analyzed: vikaṭa nitambāyāḥ amaru  s bh suau
translated: Of the one with well-rounded buttocks, Amaru.

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka / 🔽mā rodīḥ sakhi naśyadandhatamasaṃ paśyāmbaraṃ jyotsnayā śītāṃśuḥ sudhayā vilimpati sakhā rājño manojanmanaḥ /
analyzed: skmsauka  mā rodīḥ sakhi naśyat andha tamasam paśya ambaram jyotsnayā śītāṃśuḥ sudhayā vilimpati sakhā rājñaḥ manaḥ janmanaḥ
translated: SVSUS MU SKMS U KA🔽Do not weep, friend, see the sky, its blinding darkness gone, the moon, the friend of the god of love, is anointing it with nectar.

original: kaḥ kopāvasaraḥ prasīda rahasi svedāmbhasaṃ bindavo lumpantu stanapatrabhaGgam akarīḥ saudhāguruśyāmalāḥ // / //
analyzed: kaḥ kopa avasaraḥ prasīda rahasi sveda ambhasam bindavaḥ lumpantu stana patra bhaggam akarīḥ saudha aguru śyāmalāḥ  /
translated: What occasion is there for anger? Be gracious. Let the dark-blue sandal paste from the palace remove the drops of sweat on your breasts, which are like the petals of a lotus.

original: kasyacit
analyzed: kasyacid
translated: Of someone

original: mā rodīḥ jarapallavapraṇayinīṃ kṛtvā kapolasthalīṃ mā bhaṅgīḥ parikhedasākṣibhir iva śvāsair mukhendoḥ śriyam /
analyzed: mā rodīḥ jara pallava praṇayinīm kṛtvā kapola sthalīm mā bhaṅgīḥ parikheda sākṣibhiḥ iva śvāsaiḥ mukha indoḥ śriyam
translated: Do not weep, making the cheek, fond of old age's sprouts, your pillow. Do not spoil the beauty of the moon of your face with sighs, as if they were witnesses to your fatigue.

original: mugdhe dagdhagiraḥ skhalanti śataśaḥ kiM kupyasi preyasi prāṇās tanvi mamāsi nocitam idaṃ tad vyartham uttāmyasi // / //
analyzed: mugdhe dagdha giraḥ skhalanti śataśas kim kupyasi preyasi prāṇāḥ tanvi mama asi nā ucitam idam tat vyartham uttāmyasi  /
translated: O innocent one, hundreds of burning words slip out, why be angry, dear one? O slender one, you are my life, this is not proper, so you are needlessly agitated.

original: kasyacit
analyzed: kasyacid
translated: Of someone.

original: yad etan netrāmbhaḥ patad api samāsādya taruṇī kapolavyāsaṅgaṃ kucakalaśam asyāḥ kalayati /
analyzed: yat etat netra ambhaḥ patat api samāsādya taruṇī kapola vyāsaṅgam kuca kalaśam asyāḥ kalayati
translated: That this falling tear-water, having reached the cheek of the young woman, takes care of her bosom-pot.

original: tataḥ śroṇībimbaṃ vyavasitavilāsaṃ tad ucitaṃ svabhāvasvacchānāṃ vipad api sukhaṃ nāntarayati // / //🔽kasyacit / Spdśā /pa / /
analyzed: tatas śroṇī bimbam vyavasita vilāsam tat ucitam svabhāva su acchānām vipad api sukham na antarayati  / kasyacid
translated: Then that intended amorous play on her hip-image, natural clarity of those who are suitable, even misfortune does not obstruct happiness.🔽Of someone.

original: Smk / / Srb / Any /
analyzed: an
translated: Of Smṛtijñānakīrti.

original: pakṣmāntaḥ skhalitāḥ kapolaphalake lolaṃ luṭhantaḥ kṣaṇaṃ dhārālās taralocchalattanukaṇāḥ pīnastanāsphālanāt /
analyzed: pakṣma antar skhalitāḥ kapola phalake lolam luṭhantaḥ kṣaṇam dhārālāḥ tarala ucchalat tanu kaṇāḥ pīna stana āsphālanāt
translated: Falling between the eyelashes, rolling playfully for a moment on the cheek, the streams of tears, with tiny quivering drops, from the pressing of the full breasts,

original: kasmād brūhi tavādya kaṇṭhavigalanmuktāvalīvibhramaṃ bibhrāṇā nipatanti bāṣpapayasāṃ prasyandino bindavaḥ // / //
analyzed: kasmāt brūhi tava adya kaṇṭha vigalat muktā āvalī vibhramam bibhrāṇāḥ nipatanti bāṣpa payasām prasyandinaḥ bindavaḥ  /
translated: tell me, why do the drops of flowing tear-water, bearing the charm of a pearl necklace slipping from the neck, fall today?

original: rājaśekharasya / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: rājaśekharasya
translated: Of Rājaśekhara.

original: kapole patrālī karatalanirodhena mṛditā nipīto niḥśvāsair ayam amṛtahṛdyo 'dhararasaḥ /
analyzed: kapole patra ālī kara tala nirodhena mṛditā nipītaḥ niḥśvāsaiḥ ayam amṛta hṛdyaḥ dhara rasaḥ
translated: The line on the cheek is rubbed by the palm, this nectar-pleasing lip-juice is drunk by the sighs,

original: muhuḥ kaṇṭhe lagnas taralayati bāṣpaḥ stanataṭaṃ priyo manyur jātas tava niranurodhe na tu vayam // / //
analyzed: muhur kaṇṭhe lagnaḥ taralayati bāṣpaḥ stana taṭam priyaḥ manyuḥ jātaḥ tava niranurodhe na tu vayam  /
translated: The tears, repeatedly clinging to the throat, make the breasts tremble. You are angry, not caring for me, but not we.

original: Amaru / Skmsa /u /ka / /
analyzed: amaru
translated: Amaru. SKMs. U. K.

original: Sksa /ka /ā /v / Svsu /ā /
analyzed: sk sa kau su su ā
translated: SKs. K. A. V. SSu. A.

original: dhik dhik tvām ayi kena durmukhi kṛtaṃ kiṃ kiṃ na kāyavrataṃ dvitrāṇy atra dināni ko na kupitaḥ ko nābhavan mānuṣaḥ /
analyzed: dhik dhik tvām ayi kena durmukhi kṛtam kim kim na kāya vratam dvitrāṇi atra dināni kaḥ na kupitaḥ kaḥ nā abhavat mānuṣaḥ
translated: Fie, fie on you, O you with a sullen face! What vow of self-mortification has been performed by you? Who has not been angry here for two or three days? Who has not become a human being?

original: smaḥ kecin na vayaṃ yad ekam aparasyāpy uktam ākarṇyatāṃ atyunmāthini candane 'pi niyataṃ nāmāgnir uttiṣṭhati // / //
analyzed: smaḥ kecid na vayam yat ekam aparasya api uktam ākarṇyatām ati unmāthini candane niyatam nāma agniḥ uttiṣṭhati  /
translated: We are some, but not all. Let it be heard what has been said by another. Even in very destructive sandal paste, fire certainly arises.

original: vallaṇasya
analyzed: vallaṇasya
translated: Of Vallabha.

original: sphuṭatu hṛdayaṃ kāmaṃ kāmaṃ karatu tanuṃ tanuṃ na sakhi caṭulapremṇā kāryaṃ punar dayitena me /
analyzed: sphuṭatu hṛdayam kāmam kāmam karatu tanum tanum na sakhi caṭula premṇā kāryam punar dayitena me
translated: Let my heart burst, let my body be reduced to a hundred pieces, but, O friend, I will not again have to do with my fickle-hearted lover.

original: iti sarabhasaṃ mānāṭopād udīrya vacas tayā ramaṇapadavī sāraṅgākṣyā saśaṅkitam īkṣitā // / //
analyzed: iti sa rabhasam māna āṭopāt udīrya vacaḥ tayā ramaṇa padavī sāraṅga akṣyā sa śaṅkitam īkṣitā
translated: Having thus spoken these words in a fit of violent anger, the fawn-eyed one looked askance at the path taken by her lover, suspecting something.

original: Amaru / Skmsa /u /ka / / Smvsū /mu / /
analyzed: amaru
translated: Amaru. SKMs. U. K. SSmVsU. MU.

original: ekasmin śayane parāṅmukhatayā vītottaraṃ tāmyator anyonyasya hṛdi sthite 'py anunaye saṃrakṣator gauravam /
analyzed: ekasmin śayane parāṅmukha tayā vītottaram tāmyatoḥ anyonyasya hṛdi sthite pi anunaye saṃrakṣatoḥ gauravam
translated: On the same bed, turning away from each other, brooding in silence, with anger still in their hearts, but guarding their honor,

original: dampatyoḥ śanakair apāṅgavalanān miśrībhavaccakṣuṣor bhagno mānakaliḥ sahāsarabhasaṃ vyāsaktakaṇṭhagraham // / //🔽amaroḥ Amaru /
analyzed: dampatyoḥ śanakais apāṅga valanāt miśrībhavat cakṣuṣoḥ bhagnaḥ mānakaliḥ sa hāsa rabhasam vyāsakta kaṇṭha graham       amaroḥ amaru
translated: the couple gradually broke the quarrel, their eyes meeting as they turned their heads, and their necks entwined in a tight embrace.🔽O immortal one!

original: Svsu /ā / /
analyzed: su su ā
translated: O my beloved!

original: Spdśā /pa / /
analyzed: sp śāpa
translated: O Shachi!🔽O Smriti!🔽O Mukunda!

original: Smvsū /mu / / / Skmsa /u /ka / 🔽kandarpakandali salīkadṛśā lunīhi kopāṅkuraṃ caraṇayoḥ śaraṇātithiḥ syām /
analyzed: skmsauka  kandarpa kandali salīka dṛśā lunīhi kopa aṅkuram caraṇayoḥ śaraṇa atithiḥ syām
translated: O Krishna!🔽O Kandarpa! O Kandalini! With your true eyes, cut off the sprout of anger and be a guest at my feet.

original: paśya prasīda caramācalacūlacumbi bimbaṃ vidhor lavalapāṇḍurasas tam eti // / //
analyzed: paśya prasīda carama acala cūla cumbi bimbam vidhoḥ lavala pāṇḍu rasaḥ tam eti  /
translated: Look, be gracious! The orb of the moon, kissing the peak of the western mountain, is becoming pale like a lavali leaf.

original: aho divyaṃ cakṣur vahasi tava sāpi praṇayinī parākṣṇām agrāhyaṃ yuvatiṣu vapuḥ saṃkramayati /
analyzed: aho divyam cakṣuḥ vahasi tava sā api praṇayinī para akṣṇām agrāhyam yuvatiṣu vapuḥ saṃkramayati
translated: Ah! You possess divine vision, for that beloved of yours transfers her body, unobtainable by other eyes, to other women.

original: samānābhijñānaṃ katham itarathā paśyati puro bhavān ekas tasyāḥ pratikṛtimayīr eva ramaṇīḥ // / //
analyzed: samāna abhijñānam katham itarathā paśyati puras bhavān ekaḥ tasyāḥ pratikṛti mayīḥ eva ramaṇīḥ  /
translated: How else can you, standing before her, see her with the same recognition, as if they were her own replicas?

original: manovinodasya
analyzed: manaḥ vinodasya
translated: Of Manovijnana

original: priye maunaṃ muñca śrutir amṛtadhārāṃ pibatu me dṛśāv unmīlyetāṃ bhavatu jagad indīvaramayam /
analyzed: priye maunam muñca śrutiḥ amṛta dhārām pibatu me dṛśau unmīlyetām bhavatu jagat indīvara mayam
translated: O beloved, release your silence, let my ears drink the nectar-stream, let my eyes open, let the world become full of blue lotuses.

original: prasīda premāpi praśamayatu niḥśeṣam adhṛtīr abhūmiḥ kopānāṃ nanu niraparādhaḥ parijanaḥ // / //
analyzed: prasīda prema api praśamayatu niḥśeṣam adhṛtīḥ abhūmiḥ kopānām nanu niraparādhaḥ parijanaḥ  /
translated: Be gracious, let love also completely pacify all immodesty. The retinue is indeed innocent, not a fit object for anger.

original: ḍimbokasya / Skmsa /u /ka /
analyzed: ḍimbokasya skmsauka
translated: Of Dīmbhaka.

original: kopas tvayā yadi kṛto mayi paṅkajākṣi so 'stu priyas tava kim asti vidheyam anyat /
analyzed: kopaḥ tvayā yadi kṛtaḥ mayi paṅkaja akṣi saḥ u stu priyaḥ tava kim asti vidheyam anyat
translated: If you are angry with me, O lotus-eyed one, let that beloved of yours be, what else is to be done?

original: āśleṣam arpaya madarpitapūrvam uccair uccaiḥ samarpaya madarpitacumbanaṃ ca // / //
analyzed: āśleṣam arpaya mad arpita pūrvam uccais uccais samarpaya mad arpita cumbanam ca
translated: Give me the embrace given by you before, give me the kiss given by you again and again.

original: śatānandasya
analyzed: śatānandasya
translated: Of Śatānanda.

original: sakhi kalitaḥ skhalito 'yaṃ heyo naiva praṇāmamātreṇa /
analyzed: sakhi kalitaḥ skhalitaḥ yam heyaḥ nā eva praṇāma mātreṇa
translated: Friend, this fault of his is slight, it should not be discarded merely by bowing down.

original: ciram anubhavatu bhavatyā bāhulatābandhanaṃ dhūrtaḥ // / //
analyzed: ciram anubhavatu bhavatyāḥ bāhu latā bandhanam dhūrtaḥ  /
translated: Let the rogue long experience the bondage of your creeper-like arms.

original: gonandasya
analyzed: gonandasya
translated: Of Gonanda.

original: jāte kelikalau kṛte kamitari vyarthānunītau cirānd māne mlāyati manmathe vikasati kṣīṇe kṣapānehasi /
analyzed: jāte keli kalau kṛte kamitari vyartha anunītau māne mlāyati manmathe vikasati kṣīṇe kṣapā nehasi
translated: When the quarrel in love-play was brought to an end, and after a long time the anger of the beloved had faded away, and when love had withered, and the night, the abode of darkness, had waned,

original: māyāsvāpam upetya tannipuṇayā nidrāndhyam āceṣṭitaṃ mānamlānir abhūn na yena ca na cāpy āsīd rahaḥkhaṇḍanam // / //
analyzed: māyā svāpam upetya tad nipuṇayā nidrā āndhyam āceṣṭitam māna mlāniḥ abhūt na yena ca na ca api āsīt rahaḥ khaṇḍanam
translated: Having resorted to the sleep of illusion, and having displayed the blindness of sleep skillfully, by which she did not become faded with pride, nor was there a secret rebuke.

original: kathaṃcin naidāghe divasa iva kope vigalite prasattau prāptāyāṃ tadanu ca niśāyām iva śanaiḥ /
analyzed: kathaṃcid naidāghe divase iva kope vigalite prasattau prāptāyām tadanu ca niśāyām iva śanais
translated: Somehow, when anger has subsided like a summer day, and when favor has been attained like the coming of night,

original: smitajyotsnārambhakṣapitavirahadhvāntanivahoaḥ mukhendur māninyāḥ sphurati kṛtapuṇyasya surate // / //
analyzed: smita jyotsnā ārambha kṣapita viraha dhvānta nivahaḥ mukha induḥ māninyāḥ sphurati kṛta puṇyasya surate  /
translated: the moon of the proud woman's face shines forth, with the host of the darkness of separation destroyed by the rising moonlight of her smile, for one who has done meritorious deeds in lovemaking.

original: mānavyādhinipīḍitāham adhunā śaknomi tasyāntikaṃ no gantuṃ na sakhījano 'sti caturo yo māṃ balān neṣyati /
analyzed: māna vyādhi nipīḍitā aham adhunā śaknomi tasya antikam naḥ gantum na caturaḥ yaḥ mām balāt neṣyati
translated: Now, afflicted by the disease of pride, I am unable to go near him, nor is there a clever friend who can forcibly take me there.

original: mānī so 'pi jano na lāghavabhayād abhyeti mātaḥ svayaṃ kālo yāti calaṃ ca jīvitam iti kṣuṇṇaṃ manaś cintayā // / //
analyzed: mānī saḥ pi janaḥ na lāghava bhayāt abhyeti mātar svayam kālaḥ yāti calam ca jīvitam iti kṣuṇṇam manaḥ cintayā  /
translated: And that proud person does not come himself out of fear of contempt, O mother, time passes and life is fleeting, my mind is tormented by worry.

original: yāvan no sakhi gocaraṃ nayanayor āyāti tāvad drutaṃ gatvā brūhi yathādya te dayitayā mānaḥ samālambitaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat no sakhi gocaram nayanayoḥ āyāti tāvat drutam gatvā brūhi yathā adya te dayitayā mānaḥ samālambitaḥ
translated: As long as he does not come within the range of my eyes, go quickly and tell him how today your beloved has taken up pride.

original: dṛṣṭe dhūrtaviceṣṭite tu dayite tasmin avaśyaṃ mama svedāmbhaḥpratirodhinirbharatarasmeraṃ mukhaṃ jāyate // / //
analyzed: dṛṣṭe dhūrta viceṣṭite tu dayite tasmin avaśyam mama sveda ambhaḥ pratirodhi nirbhara tarasmeram mukham jāyate  /
translated: But when I see the tricks of that rogue, my dear, my face, which is full of a very intense smile, becomes the obstacle to the sweat-water.

analyzed: ṣ sūkti muktāvalī
